title: Drawing, "Design for a Confidante, an Etruscan Arm Chair, and a Silver Cup", ca. 1920–35
medium: Black chalk, brush and white gouache on oatmeal-colored laid paper
inscribed: In pen and brown ink at right of confidante: Covered in / Satin; [below] Design for a Confidante for Sir Abrm Hume/ Adelphi Oct 1777/ Robt Adam
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Seligmann
description: At top of sheet, elevation of the back of a confidante with pattern of fabric indicated. At lower left, partial view of an arm chair in the Etruscan manner with winged sphinx as arm rest, shadow of front leg indicated. At lower center, two handled silver cup is sketched lightly in black chalk.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Confidante, an Etruscan Arm Chair, and a Silver Cup", ca. 1920–35.
ca. 1920–35. Black chalk, brush and white gouache on oatmeal-colored laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Seligmann. 1946-14-1.
